alert.note: Alert for St. Clair; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 1:26PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Talladega and south central St. Clair Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 126 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Winterboro, or 7 miles south of Talladega, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Talladega, Pell City, Lincoln, Vincent, Waldo, Alpine Bay Resort, Winterboro, Alpine, Logan Martin Lake, Coosa Island, Logan Martin Dam, Country Club Estates, St. Clair County Airport, Chandler Springs, Cropwell and Howells Cove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Birmingham.
